title: Electric force - 2 negative objects and gravity

content.question: Two small, charged objects are located along a vertical line above the surface of Earth, as shown in the figure. The higher object has mass <math alttext="m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and negative charge <math alttext="negative q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math>, and the lower object has mass <math alttext="m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> and the same negative charge <math alttext="negative q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math>. The two objects are a distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> apart, and the lower object is the same distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> above Earth’s surface. Gravitational attraction between the two small objects is negligible. Earth has mass <math alttext="M sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>M</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></msub></math> and radius <math alttext="R sub E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></msub></math> and can be considered to be electrically neutral. What is the magnitude of the net force on the higher object of mass <math alttext="m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="k times the fraction with numerator q squared and denominator D squared, end fraction plus G times the fraction with numerator m sub 1 M sub E and denominator, open parenthesis 2 D close parenthesis, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mfrac><msup><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>G</mi><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>M</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>D</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="k times the fraction with numerator q squared and denominator D squared, end fraction plus G times the fraction with numerator m sub 1 M sub E and denominator, open parenthesis R sub E plus 2 D close parenthesis, squared end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>k</mi><mfrac><msup><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>G</mi><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>M</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>D</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the absolute value of k times the fraction with numerator q squared and denominator D squared, end fraction minus G times the fraction with numerator m sub 1 M sub E and denominator, open parenthesis 2 D close parenthesis, squared end fraction, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><mi>k</mi><mfrac><msup><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>G</mi><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>M</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>D</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>|</mo></math>

<math alttext="the absolute value of k times the fraction with numerator q squared and denominator D squared, end fraction minus G times the fraction with numerator m sub 1 M sub E and denominator, open parenthesis R sub E plus 2 D close parenthesis, squared end fraction close parenthesis, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><mi>k</mi><mfrac><msup><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>G</mi><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>M</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>D</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>|</mo></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the absolute value of k times the fraction with numerator q squared and denominator D squared, end fraction minus G times the fraction with numerator m sub 1 M sub E and denominator, open parenthesis R sub E plus 2 D close parenthesis, squared end fraction close parenthesis, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><mi>k</mi><mfrac><msup><mi>q</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><msup><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mi>G</mi><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>M</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub></mrow><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>E</mtext></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>D</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac><mo>|</mo></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
